_header: The masters that usen blood letting
Note: Formerly 3848; cf. 1570; for a variant version see 6847.
Bibliographic Ghosts: Oxford, Bodleian Library Ashmole 391, Part II.5 (SC 6733), f. 9: see 1570; London, British Library Sloane 610, ff. 5-6: see 1570
_description: Poem on Phlebotomy or Bloodletting — in couplets, often with an introduction of six lines, for a total of 90 lines

BodSelSup73.First Lines:
Maistres ye that vsen blode lettyngeAnd therby goten youre
                    lyuyngeHere May ye lerne Wysdome goodeWhat plase that ye shall letten
                    blode
BodSelSup73.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 77-80.

BodArcSelSup90.First Lines:
Alle ȝe þat vsyn blod letyngAnd þerbi getiþ
                    ȝoure levyngHere may ȝe lern wysdome goodeWhat place ȝe
                    schal lete blod

BodAsh391II.First Lines:
Alle ye þat vse bloode letingAnd þerby geeten your
                    lyvyngHere mow ye lere wisdem goodeIn what place ye shul lete
                    bloode
BodAsh391II.Note:
Ends imperfectly due to loss of folio: 49 lines only, written as
                    prose

BodAsh1448.First Lines:
The masters þat vse blode lettyngAnd þer by gete her
                    levyngHere may thei lere wisdome godeWhat place thei shulde lett
                    blode

BodAsh1477.First Lines:
Thes masters þat vse blode lettyngeAnd there by getteth
                    þer lyuyngeHere ye maye here wysdome godeIn what place ye schalle
                    lett blode
BodAsh1477.Note:
88 lines; on f. 96 ‘Here it techethe a man to knowe þe veynys
                    And where þat they schalle be fownde fore blode lettynge on man or
                    woman where euer that they sytt’.

BodAsh1481.First Lines:
[Ȝ]e maysters þat vsen blod latyng& þere with
                    getyn here lyuyngHere ȝe may lere wysdam godeIn wat place
                    ȝow schal lat blode
BodAsh1481.Attributed Title: Her be gynne þe knowing of veynys (f. 25v)

BodRawC506.First Lines:
The mastyrs þat vse blod lattyngAnd þer by gettiþ
                    þer lyvyngHer may þai lern wisdom goodIn what place þai
                    shall let blod

BodRawD251.First Lines:
Ȝe mastrys þat off phisik canneAnd by gete ȝour
                    goodHer may ȝe lern wysdom þanWhat placys ȝe xuld lete
                    blode

CamTCC1037.First Lines:
…The myddel veyne be twex þe toÞe Coral he is
                    clepyd soThat veyn clenseth with owte dowteA bove be neþe with
                    Inne & with owte
CamTCC1037.Note: Begins imperfectly due to loss of folio; begins line 57.
CamTCC1037.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS O.1.13.
         https://mss-cat.trin.cam.ac.uk/Manuscript/O.1.13.

CamTCC1440.First Lines:
Men þat vsyn blodlatyngAnd therby geten here lewyngHer
                    they may leren wysdam godIn quat place they xuln laten blod

BLAdd30338.First Lines:
Alle ye þat vsyth blode letyng & þer by getyþ your
                    leuyng …Here may ye lerne wysdoom good what place ȝe
                    schulle
BLAdd30338.Last Lines:
…yf þu þese vse at þy nede þe forseyde euylys
                    þu dar not dredeSo þrouwȝ crystys helpyng þat all hath
                    in gouernyng
BLAdd30338.Note: Written one couplet per line: 45 couplets or 90 lines.

BLEge1995.First Lines:
The maysters that vsyn bloode latyngeAnd there by gete there
                    leuynge…
BLEge1995.Last Lines: …So mote hyt be sey nowe weAmen Amen for charyte

BLSl100.First Lines:
Ȝe maistris þat vsen blood letyngeAnd þer wiþ
                    geten ȝoure lyuyngeHere mai ȝe lerne wijsdom goodIn what
                    place ȝe schulen lete blood

BLSl357.First Lines:
The maystres þat vsith blode letyngAnd þus doith gaith
                    here leuyngHere ȝe may lerne wysdom godeIn whate place ȝe
                    schull lete blode

BLSl540A.First Lines:
Þys maystres þat vsed blod letyngAnd þer by geten
                    here lyuyngHere he may lerne wysdom ful goudIn wych places he schul
                    lete blod
BLSl540A.Note: 90 lines, followed by pose text on perilous days

BLSl963.First Lines:
The maystris that vse blood latyngeAnd þere by ȝe gete
                    ȝoure leuyngeHere may ȝe lere wysdam goodWhat place ȝe
                    schull lete blood
BLSl963.Editions:
Mooney,  Linne R. 
             “Practical Didactic Works in Middle English.” 
         Diss. Toronto, 1981: 139-55.

BLSl2457.First Lines:
The maystres that vsen blood lettyngAnd ther by gether her
                    lyuyngHer ȝe may lerne wysdam goodIn wat place ȝe schal late
                    blood

BLSl3160.First Lines:
The maystris þat vson blode lettyngAnd þer by geten hor
                    levyngHer thai may lerne wysdam godeIn what place þay schulde
                    lette blode

BLSl3285.First Lines:
The maistres that vsith blood letyngeAnd therby getith your
                    lyuyngeHyer ye may lerne wisdom goodIn what place ye shal late
                    blood…
BLSl3285.Last Lines:
…Yf thou vse thise veynes at nedeOf euelis for nemenyd dar ton
                    naught dredeSo that god helpe
BLSl3285.Note: 88 lines. Folio number reflects the most recent foliation
BLSl3285.Attributed Title: How thou shalt knowe veynes for blod letyng (f.75)

BLAdd18216.First Lines:
…that vset blod latynge & therby gete her leuyngeHer
                    mayȝe lerne wysdam good & yn what place ȝe schole lete blod
                    …
BLAdd18216.Last Lines:
…Ȝif þu hem vse at þi nede þe forseyd euelys
                    thar þe nowt dredeSo god be helpyng þat al hath yn
                    gouernynge
BLAdd18216.Note:
Written one couplet per line; 46 couplets, or 92 lines. Initial two
                    words indecipherable. Scribe uses ‘þ’ and ‘y’
                    graphs interchangeably to represent thorn.

DULCosViii10.First Lines:
Ȝe mastris þat vsyn blod letyngAnd þer with getyn
                    her leuyngHer ye mey ler wysedom goodIn what place ye schall be let
                    blod

GULHun258.First Lines:
Here ye may lerne wisdom ful goodIn which placis ye shall lete
                    blode……And in what place þey shalbe foundeI shall you
                    tell in lityl stounde…
GULHun258.Note:
Ten lines only, including 4-line preface; added to blank space at end of
                        Studium sapiencie.
GULHun258.Editions:
Young,  John,  and  Patrick Henderson Aitken.  
             A Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of the Hunterian
                Museum.
         Glasgow: James Maclehose, 1908: 210.

Wellcome406.First Lines:
Maystris þat uþyth bl[ ]de letyng& þer wyþ
                    geteþ ȝour [ ]Here ȝe may lere wysdom ful godeIn what
                    plase ȝe schull let blode…
Wellcome406.Last Lines:
…Ȝyf yow þys vse at þi nedeOf [?þe] euelys
                    dar ȝe noȝt dredeSo [?god …of] lor[?]e be helpyng[?]
                    haþ in gouernyng
Wellcome406.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.189-90.

NatLibMed514.First Lines: ȜE maisters þat vse blode latingAnd þerby gete yowr leving…
NatLibMed514.Last Lines: …yff þou vse theise at nedeOf þe evill vij forn þar þou not dredeSo that lordis be helpingþat al thing hath in welding
NatLibMed514.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of U.S. National Library of Medicine (Bethesda, MD) MS E 4.
         https://collections.nlm.nih.gov/bookviewer?PID=nlm:nlmuid-100899906-bk.
NatLibMed514.Editions:
Mayer,  Claudius F. 
             “A Medieval English Leechbook and its 14th Century Poem on
                Bloodletting.” 
             Bulletin of the History of Medicine
         7 (1939): 381-91: 388-90.
